metadata.description: Location for all resources.
Version of SharePoint farm to create.
"[Prefix]" of public DNS name of VMs, as used in "[Prefix]-[VMName].[region].cloudapp.azure.com"
FQDN of the AD forest to create
Select whether a SharePoint Front End VM should be provisioned and joined to the farm.
Name of the AD and SharePoint administrator. 'administrator' is not allowed
Input must meet password complexity requirements as documented for property 'adminPassword' in https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/compute/virtualmachines/virtualmachines-create-or-update

Password for all service account and SharePoint passphrase. It must meet password complexity requirements as documented for property 'adminPassword' in https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/compute/virtualmachines/virtualmachines-create-or-update
Size of the DC VM
Type of storage for the managed disks. Allowed values are 'Standard_LRS', 'Standard_GRS' and 'Premium_LRS'
Size of the SQL VM
Type of storage for the managed disks. Allowed values are 'Standard_LRS', 'Standard_GRS' and 'Premium_LRS'
Size of the SharePoint VM
Type of storage for the managed disks. Allowed values are 'Standard_LRS', 'Standard_GRS' and 'Premium_LRS'
Time zone of the VMs. Type "[TimeZoneInfo]::GetSystemTimeZones().Id" in PowerShell to get the list. Note that 'UTC' works but 'UTC+xx' does NOT work.
The time at which VMs will be automatically shutdown (24h HHmm format). Set value to '9999' to NOT configure the auto shutdown.
Enable automatic Windows Updates.

Enable Azure Hybrid Benefit to use your on-premises Windows Server licenses and reduce cost. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/windows/hybrid-use-benefit-licensing for more information.
Size in Gb of the additional data disk attached to SharePoint VMs. Set to 0 to not create it
Specify if Azure Bastion should be provisioned. See https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/azure-bastion for more information.
Specify if each VM should have a public IP and be reachable from Internet.

The base URI where artifacts required by this template are located. When the template is deployed using the accompanying scripts, a private location in the subscription will be used and this value will be automatically generated.
The sasToken required to access _artifactsLocation. When the template is deployed using the accompanying scripts, a sasToken will be automatically generated.
